bibl.title: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand v. M. Angelique. Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The Superior Court of King County

div1.p: In the Superior Court of King County State of Washington
In the matter of the application of Yvonne Le fevre and Georgette Normand Marie Le Fevre for a writ of Habeas Corpus} PETITION
To the Honorable judges of the above entitled court: Your petitioner, H.C.Gill, respectfully petitions and shows to the Court as follows:-
That he is one of the attorneys for the above named Yvonne Le Fevre, Marie Le Fevre and Georgette Normand, and make this petition and application in their behalf.

That the above named Yvonne LeFevre, Marie LeFevre and Georgette Normand are restrained of thier liberty by the House of the Good Shepard, a religious institution in the City of Seattle, and by sister M.Angelique, the Sister Superior thereof.

That the cause or pretense of the said restraint and unlawful detention of the said Yvonne LeFevre Marie LeFevre and Georgette Normand is, according to the best knowledge and belief of your petitioner and applicant, a request from the Honorable P. Lavin, a United States Emigration Inspector, that they be so restrained.

That the said restraint is illegal, and the illegality thereof consists on this, That the said Yvonne LeFevre, Marie LeFevre and Georgette Normand are not held by virtue of any lawfully issued
warrant or process from any court; and further in that the said house of the Good Shepard and the Sister Superior therof have no lawful authority from any state or from the United States of America to restrain the persons the said Yvonne LeFevre, Marie LeFevre and Georgette Normand.

WHEREFORE your petitioner prays that an order for a Writ of Habeas Corpus be issued herein directing the said M. Angelique to have and produce before this court at a time and place to be fixed by the Court to do and receive what shall be ordered concerning the said Yvonne LeFevre and Georgette Normand, and to have then and there the said writ.
H.C. Gill Petitioner Gill Hoyt & Frye Attys for petitioner
State of Washington, County of King ss

H.C. GILL, being first dully sworn on oath says; that the is the petitioner in the above entitled action; that he has heard the forgoing petition read, knows the contents thereof, and belives the same to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 11th day of February, A.D. 1903. Herman S. Frye Notary Publicin and for the State of Washington residing at Seattle.
